III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 2/7/23 and 2/8/23, youth complained of stomach pain. Youth
has had this pain since March 2022 after their IUD was removed.
Youth saw facility medical staff, but has not been taken for further
medical treatment. Youth has an appointment 2/13/23, but
continues to be in immense pain at this time.
Investigation This complaint was received on 02/08/2023 and was investigated
jointly with the DHHS Specialist.
I interviewed Complainant via telephone on 02/09/2023 and they
reported no further information.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Worker (FCW) via telephone
on 02/09/2023. She reported Youth A was placed at the facility on
01/19/2023. Youth A had an IUD placed in January of 2022, and
had it removed in April of 2022 due to abdominal pain and
cramping. She said Youth A has a history of wanting to go to the
hospital, because it’s easier for her to AWOL. She visited Youth A
on 02/07/2023 and Youth A did not report being in pain or having
issues/concerns.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer at the facility, on
02/09/2023 in collaboration with the DHHS Specialist. He
reported Youth A was previously placed at the facility from
04/22/2022 thru 11/03/2022, returned to the facility on 01/19/2023,
and has been examined by the doctor and nurse multiple times.
Youth A has an appointment scheduled with the obstetrician on
02/13/2023. Consumer Rights Officer said he checked on Youth A
yesterday and she did not express being in pain or needing
medical attention.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 02/09/2023, in collaboration
with the DHHS Specialist. Youth A reported she has been at the
facility since 01/19/2023. She said she has been having
pain/cramping in her ovaries and was seen by the doctor and
nurse at the facility. The doctor said she can take Motrin or
Tylenol for the pain and scheduled an appointment with the
obstetrician on 02/13/2023. Youth A said she has been having this
2

pain on and off since last year when she had an IUD placed in
March, but then had the IUD removed in April due to abdominal
pain. Youth A said she is having some pain/discomfort, but it is not
severe. Youth A admitted that sometimes she refuses to take the
pain medication.
I interviewed Nurse 1 at the facility on 02/09/2023, in collaboration
with the DHHS Specialist. Nurse 1 reported she assessed Youth A
on 02/08/2023 because Youth A was complaining about
abdominal pain. Youth A was given Motrin for the pain and was
offered Motrin again in the evening, but she declined the
medication. Nurse 1 said Youth A was examined on 01/19/2023
for the intake assessment and Youth A did not report abdominal
pain. Youth A was examined by the Doctor on campus on
01/23/2023, and Youth A reported she was having irregular
periods and occasional abdominal pain, so an appointment was
scheduled with the obstetrician for 02/13/2023. Nurse 1 said
Youth A had an IUD placed last year in March, but it was removed
in April due to abdominal cramping.
I interviewed Staff 1 via video conference at the facility, on
02/09/2023, in collaboration with the DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is
the Shift Supervisor and has been employed at the facility for 2
years 9 months. She reported Youth A has complained on and off
about stomach pain/cramping, but when she is offered ibuprofen,
she refused the medication. She said last week Youth A said her
stomach was hurting her and a few minutes later she was
observed laughing, playing around with the other residents, and
eating her meal. Staff 1 said when a youth reports not feeling well
or being in pain the supervisor contacts the nurse and nurse does
an assessment and contacts the doctor. She said Youth A was
assessed by the nurse and examined by the doctor multiple times
due to her complaints.
I interviewed Doctor on 03/08/2023 via telephone. Doctor reported
she examined Youth A twice last month for abdominal pain and
scheduled her an appointment with an obstetrician. When Youth A
saw the obstetrician on 02/13/2023, Youth A asked to have an
IUD placed, but did not report having abdominal pain.
A predisposition conference call held with DHHS Specialist on
03/09/2023 resulted in no findings.
Pre-Exit email sent to the Consumer Rights Officer on 04/03/2023.
Documentation reviewed as part of this investigation:
3

• Facility Medical Complaints Policy: If a client becomes
seriously ill or is injured, the shift Supervisor and or Team
Leader must take prompt steps to obtain medical care for
the client.
• Medical records for Youth A.
➢ 01/19/2023 Nurse Intake Assessment, Youth A
denied any abdominal pain.
➢ 01/23/2023 Well Child Exam, Youth A reported
having irregular periods and occasional
abdominal pain. Obstetrician appointment
scheduled and doctor prescribed Ibuprofen.
➢ 02/06/2023 Doctor examination, Youth A
complained about abdominal pain that increases
before her cycle.
➢ 02/08/2023 Nurse Assessment, Youth A
complained about abdominal pain and was
provided Ibuprofen.
➢ 02/13/2023 Obstetrician examination. Youth A
had an IUD placed.
• AWOL Incident Reports for Youth A dated: 03/01/2023,
03/01/2023, 03/02/2023, and 03/06/2023.
Analysis The facility is not in violation as the documentation provided by the
facility and interviews with Staff, Nurse, Doctor, and Youth A,
confirmed Youth A is being provided the medical care required for
her abdominal pain.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
